intro: Spiloxene ovata, commonly known as the oval spiloxene, is a flowering plant species native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes willows and evening primroses. The plant is characterized by its delicate, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are ovate, with a smooth texture and a slightly serrated edge. Spiloxene ovata typically grows in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in open woodlands.
